snippet: Roderick Covlin, who is charged with strangling Shele Danishefsky Covlin in 2009, was denied bail and portrayed by the prosecutors as a desperate man facing financial ruin and the loss of his children.
abstract: Judge Bonnie G Wittner denies bail to Roderick Covlin, who is charged with 2009 murder of his estranged wife Shele Danishefsky Covlin; Wittner takes unusual step of barring Covlin from speaking to anyone but his lawyer in attempt to keep him from sending messages to witnesses.
lead_paragraph: Roderick Covlin, who is charged with strangling Shele Danishefsky Covlin in 2009, was denied bail and portrayed by the prosecutors as a desperate man facing financial ruin and the loss of his children.

headline.main: Manhattan Man Charged in Wife’s Killing Is Barred From Talking to Anyone but Lawyer
